person.persName: John Watson Foster (Evansville, Indiana, attorney and colonel (U.S.A.))

body.p: Evansville, Indiana, attorney and soldier. Indiana native. Son of M.W Foster. Married to Mary P. Foster. Resident in Vanderburgh County, Indiana in 1850. Graduated from Indiana State University in 1855. Attended Harvard Law School. Attorney in Evansville, Indiana in 1860. Employed Louisa Lickmeyer in Evansville, Indiana in 1860. Served in the United States Army as a major in 1861. Served in 65th Indiana Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from August 24, 1862 to March 10, 1864. Resigned for health reasons. Served in the 136th Indiana Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from May 21, 1864 to August 29, 1864.
